intro: Calyptranthera viridiflava, commonly known as the green-flowered calyptranthera, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Calyptranthera viridiflava is primarily found in tropical rainforests and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
